interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Three Movies of the Heart: Change of Heart, Her Desperate Choice, The Truth About Jane (3 Disc Set)
Review Date: 2017/04/26
Store: Stockard Channing  (Actor),     Jean Smart  (Actor),     Arvin Brown  (Director),     Michael Scott  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, LGBT
Product Description: ["Three emotional and dramatic Movies of the Heart:Change of Heart - Beneath Jim Marshall's (John Terry) veneer as the all-American father and husband lies a long suppressed desire that is about to ruin his idyllic family. When Elaine Marshall (Jean Smart) catches her husband and his lover in a hotel room, her anger quickly turns to shock as she discovers that Jim's paramour is a young man. What ensues is painful soul-searching for Jim, Elaine, and their family.Her Desperate Choice - Despite allegations of sexual abuse against her ex-husband, Jody (Faith Ford) has lost a custody battle for Samantha (Hanna Hall) and faces a choice of turning her daughter over to him, or taking flight and risking kidnapping charges. Pursued by both the FBI and a private detective, Jody and Samantha become hunted animals, fleeing from town to town with the help of an Underground Railroad set up to help women and children escape from abuse.The Truth About Jane - Jane's mom (Stockard Channing) assumes her daughter is just like every other sixteen-year-old girl - a little confused about growing up. Jane (Ellen Muth) figures her mom is just like every other mom - a little too protective, but loving. They figure they have a good relationship, until Jane falls in love with the new girl at school. Jane knows she is gay but her mom is completely unwilling to accept this fact. Their mother-daughter relationship is broken unless they can find a way to remember how much they love each other."]
Average Rating: 5.0
Product Details: {'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Lee Rose, Stockard Channing, Faith Ford, Jean Smart, Michael Scott, Arvin Brown', 'Runtime': '4 hours and 32 minutes', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.93 Ounces', 'Director': 'Arvin Brown, Michael Scott, Lee Rose', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours and 32 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 14, 2012', 'Actors': 'Stockard Channing, Jean Smart, Faith Ford', 'Studio': 'Fisher Klingenstein Films', 'Number of discs': '3'}
Review Text: nice combo
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0

The user continues to favor media with compelling storytelling and engaging character dynamics, particularly within fantasy and adventure genres, and is increasingly drawn to emotional narratives that explore complex themes. Their recent purchase of a collection featuring LGBT-centric stories indicates a broadening appreciation for diverse narratives and character experiences that challenge traditional perspectives.

The preference for content offering enhanced audio options and various subtitles remains unchanged, reflecting their ongoing sensitivity to sound clarity and accessibility needs. They appear open to adult themes, as evidenced by their engagement with emotionally charged narratives that include conflict and character development.

Their rating behavior is consistently positive, with a continued average of 4.9, bolstered by their recent 5.0 rating for a collection that resonated with them, highlighting their enjoyment of character-driven storytelling. This strong approval signals a discerning but enthusiastic approach to media selection.

The user's engagement style shows a robust emotional connection to narratives and characters, as seen in their brief but positive commentary on recent purchases. Overall, they clearly value high-quality, character-driven content, with an appreciation for films that explore emotional depth and tough themes, while still emphasizing accessibility and an engaged viewing experience through high ratings and positive reviews.
